parameters.name: XExpression
parameters.description: For a parametric curve, equation for x in terms of t; for an explicit curve, an empty string (see Remarks )

parameters.name: YExpression
parameters.description: For a parametric curve, equation for y in terms of t; for an explicit curve, equation for y in terms of x (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ZExpression
parameters.description: Equation for z in terms of t (see Remarks )

parameters.name: RangeStart
parameters.description: Start value for x, if explicit; start value for t, if parametric (see Remarks )

parameters.name: RangeEnd
parameters.description: End value for x, if explicit; start value for t, if parametric (see Remarks )

parameters.name: IsAngleRange
parameters.description: True if the range and x value represent an angle (in radians), false if not (see Remarks )

parameters.name: RotationAngle
parameters.description: True if the range and x value represent an angle (in radians), false if not (see Remarks )

parameters.name: XOffset
parameters.description: Rotation angle (in radians) for the curve (see Remarks )

parameters.name: YOffset
parameters.description: Translation in the x direction of the curve (see Remarks )

parameters.name: LockStart
parameters.description: Translation in the y direction of the curve (see Remarks )

parameters.name: LockEnd
parameters.description: True to lock the start point (RangeStart) of the curve, false to not

title: ISketchManager.CreateEquationSpline2
description: Creates an equation-driven 2D explicit or parametric curve or a 3D parametric curve.
signature:
SketchSpline CreateEquationSpline2( 
   System.String
XExpression
,
   System.String
YExpression
,
   System.String
ZExpression
,
   System.String
RangeStart
,
   System.String
RangeEnd
,
   System.Boolean
IsAngleRange
,
   System.Double
RotationAngle
,
   System.Double
XOffset
,
   System.Double
YOffset
,
   System.Boolean
LockStart
,
   System.Boolean
LockEnd
)

parameters.name: XExpression
parameters.description: For a parametric curve, equation for x in terms of t; for an explicit curve, an empty string (see Remarks )

parameters.name: YExpression
parameters.description: For a parametric curve, equation for y in terms of t; for an explicit curve, equation for y in terms of x (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ZExpression
parameters.description: Equation for z in terms of t (see Remarks )

parameters.name: RangeStart
parameters.description: Start value for x, if explicit; start value for t, if parametric (see Remarks )

parameters.name: RangeEnd
parameters.description: End value for x, if explicit; start value for t, if parametric (see Remarks )

parameters.name: IsAngleRange
parameters.description: True if the range and x value represent an angle (in radians), false if not (see Remarks )

parameters.name: RotationAngle
parameters.description: True if the range and x value represent an angle (in radians), false if not (see Remarks )

parameters.name: XOffset
parameters.description: Rotation angle (in radians) for the curve (see Remarks )

parameters.name: YOffset
parameters.description: Translation in the x direction of the curve (see Remarks )

parameters.name: LockStart
parameters.description: Translation in the y direction of the curve (see Remarks )

parameters.name: LockEnd
parameters.description: True to lock the start point (RangeStart) of the curve, false to not

remarks:
XExpression
If you want:
an explicit curve (only in 2D) of the form y=f(x), then this input should be "".
a parametric curve given in terms of the parameter t, then this input is the value of x given in terms of the parameter. For example:
x=sin(t)
YExpression
If you want:
an explicit curve (only in 2D) of the form y=f(x), then this input should be a function in terms of x to use to compute the value of y. For example:
y=exp(x)
a parametric curve given in terms of the parameter t, then this input is the value of y given in terms of the parameter. For example:
y=cos(t)
ZExpression
For 3D parametric curves, this input is the value of z given in terms of parameter t. For example:
z = t
RangeStart
and
RangeEnd
Strings so that you can input dimension names or pi; for example,
"10* width_dimension1"
or
"-pi/2"
.
XOffset
,
YOffset
,
IsAngleRange
, and
RotationAngle
In general, these parameters are not needed. They are for legacy support only. There are no equivalent 3D variables for positioning in 3D.
